greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of ordered triples of n-permutations with exactly k common descents, n>=0, 0<=k<=max(0,n-1).
comment: An ordered triple of n-permutations ( (a_1,a_2,...,a_n),(b_1,b_2,...,b_n),(c_1,c_2,...,c_n) ) has a common descent at position i, 1<=i<=n-1, if a_i > a_i+1, b_i > b_i+1 and c_i > c_i+1.
reference: R. P. Stanley, Enumerative Combinatorics, Volume I, Second Edition, example 3.18.3e, page 366.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..30, flattened
P. Flajolet and R. Sedgewick, Analytic Combinatorics, 2009; page 209.
maple: seq(seq(T(n,k), k=0..max(0, n-1)), n=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 28 2020
mathematica: Table[n!^3, {n, 0, nn}] CoefficientList[Series[(y - 1)/(y - e3[x (y - 1)]), {x, 0, nn}], {x, y}]], 1] // Grid
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Apr 26 2020
